text.text_translated:
In Britain, most people buy new clothes. They spend more than £1,000 each year. This is about four per cent of the money they get. This does not look like a lot of money. But this number hides two very bad problems. These problems are getting bigger. They are bad for all people. They are also bad for our world.

First, people buy many clothes. They use credit cards for this. British adults now have to pay back about £670 each. They have to pay this money back to credit card companies. This is 66 per cent of the money people plan for clothes each year.

Also, people spend money they do not have. And they buy things they do not need with this money. Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothes each year. Most of these clothes go into the ground with other rubbish.

In Britain, most people buy new clothes. They spend more than £1,000 each year. This is about four per cent of the money they earn. This may not seem like a lot of money. But this number hides two very worrying problems. These problems are bad for people and for nature.

First, people buy many clothes with credit cards. Now, British adults must pay back money. They must pay back about £670 each to companies. This is 66 per cent of the money for clothes each year.

Also, people spend money they do not have. They buy things they do not need with this money. Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothes each year. Most of these clothes go into the ground with other rubbish.
